description.narrative:
Target area: Inhambane and Sofala provinces. Target number of beneficiaries: 12,652 Households (63,260 individuals) Goal: To mitigate the negative impacts of drought impacting the lives of children and families in Mozambique through Food Security and Livelihoods, WASH and Nutrition interventions. Impact: To ensure children and their parents/children and their parents/careers in 2 provinces (Inhambane and Sofala) are able to meet basic needs to enable a healthy and dignified life at all times without engaging in negative coping mechanisms. Outcome: Affected households have adequate access to food and water and nutritional support to meet their daily essential needs, as well as access to market integrated livelihood activities which support their children#swellbeing.
Sector Objectives: WASH Sector - Affected communities have access to and use safe water and sanitation, and adopt improved hygiene practices, leading to reduced incidence of diarrhea and therefore risks of under/malnutrition. Output 1: Targeted households have sustained accessto safe water in sufficient quantity (for their own consumption), and improved knowledge of hygiene and sanitation practices
FSL Sector - To enable crisis-affected households to cover their immediate needs and protect/restore their livelihoods options without having to employ harmful coping strategies, especially those that pose an increased risk to women and children. Output 2: 12,652 vulnerable households in communities receive essential food baskets through market integrated support Output 3: 12,652 vulnerable households provided with livelihood inputs and support
Nutrition Sector - Establish / Provide screening and referral mechanisms to rapidlyensure treatment for severe and moderate acute malnutrition(SAM and MAM) and reduce the incidence of malnutrition in communities Output 4: More than 50% of SAM and MAM cases from the target communities are identified and referred to the respective nutritional rehabilitation services Output 5: District health services have increased capacity to plan for emergency nutrition responses
Child Protection - Promote community awareness and engagement in the protection of marginalized populations including women and children. Output 6: Increased awareness and participation of field staff and community on key child protection issues.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
